title: מערבות ליום בקשת גשמים | Ma'aravot l-Yom Baqashat Geshem — evening piyyutim for the Day of Requesting Rain by Isaac Gantwerk Mayer
author: Isaac Gantwerk Mayer

coauthors.name: Isaac Gantwerk Mayer
coauthors.bio: From a family of musicians, Isaac Gantwerk Mayer believes that creative art is one of the most powerful ways to get in touch with the divine. He composes music and poetry in Hebrew and English. (He also translates and transcribes Hebrew and Aramaic texts, adding niqqud and t'amim as needed.) Isaac runs a Jewish music transcription service, which will transcribe and set any Jewish music in any language, recorded or written. Contact his service on Facebook or via his music blog.

content:
While Gevurot Geshem is recited on Shmini Atseret, Baqashat Geshem as an addition to the birkat ha-shanim is recited later — from the seventh of Marḥeshvan in Israel, from sixty days after the Julian-calendar autumn equinox in the diaspora. This passage is added starting in the evening, but since there is no repetition at night there is no special custom for announcing its insertion. I think that’s a shame, so I wrote a series of ma’aravot (piyyuṭim to be inserted into the ma’ariv service) to be recited on the day where we begin to request rain.

The Day of Requesting Rain (Yom Baqashat Geshem) is the day on which the longer form of the birkat ha-shanim begins to be said: in Israel, the seventh of Marḥeshvan; in the Diaspora, sixty days after the Julian-calendar autum equinox. Currently, this means it’s usually the night of December 4, but in the year before a leap year it’s the night of December 5. But from 2031 on it will be on the night of December 6 in the year before a leap year and the night of December 5 elsewhere. (All of this is postponed a day when the date falls on Shabbat, since the ninth blessing is not said on Shabbat.)

Note: “The CAUSE” is used to translate the Divine Name YHVH, based on the philosophical idea of God as the Prime Mover and on the interpretation of the Name as a causative form of the copula – “causes to be.” “God” is used to translate the divine name Elohim. This translation also uses the plural pronouns They/Their/Them to refer to God as a pluralis majestatis, and to avoid the implications of God being assigned a gender. (Find Ibn Ezra’s commentary on Genesis 1:1 for a discussion of the pluralis majestatis when referring to God.) All divine referents (pronouns, epithets, names) are rendered in unicase.

וּמַעֲבִיר יוֹם וּמֵבִיא לָֽיְלָה
וּמַבְדִּיל בֵּין יוֹם וּבֵין לָֽיְלָה
יְהֹוָה צְבָאוֹת שְׁמוֹ

Blessed are You,
Cause our God,
Sovereign of eternity,
who with Their word evens the evening,
in wisdom opens gates,
and in understanding alters the eras
and changes the times
and arranges the stars in their courses in the firmament
by Their will.
Creating day and night,
rolling light from dark
and dark from light,
and making day pass and bringing night,
and distinguishing between day and night,
the Cause of Multitudes is Their name!
May the living and enduring Deity reign over us
forever and ever.
אוֹם מַגְבִּירִים מִיּוֹם עֲצַרְתָּם
בַּקָּשָׁה יוֹסִיפוּ לַתְּשִׁיעִית בְּבִרְכוֹתָם
גֶּֽשֶׁם עַל־הַשָּׂדוֹת מַשְׁקֶה תְּבוּאָתָם
דָּגָן יִתֵּן בְּתֵת גְּשָׁמֵֽינוּ בְּעִתָּם׃
A nation that empowers since the day of their assembly,[1] In the additional service of Shmini ˁAtseret, the eighth day of assembly, the phrase מָשִׁיב הַרֽוּחַ וּמוֹרִיד הַגֶּֽשֶׁם is added to the gvurot (“powers”) blessing. This is referred to as gvurot gshamim (the powers of rains) as opposed to the baqashat gshamim (the requesting of rains) for which this text was written. 
beseeching they will add to the ninth[2] The ninth blessing of the shmone ˁesreh is the birkat ha-shanim blessing to which the baqashat gshamim is added.  of their blessings:
Grant rain on the fields, watering their produce!
Duly the grain gives, as our rains are given in their time.
כַּכָּתוּב׃
וְנָתַתִּ֥י גִשְׁמֵיכֶ֖ם בְּעִתָּ֑ם

And I will give your rains in their time,

הַנֹּתֵ֣ן מָ֭טָר עַל־פְּנֵי־אָ֑רֶץ

Giving rain upon the the earth,
and sending water upon the outdoors. (Job 5:10)

שַׁאֲל֨וּ מֵיְהֹוָ֤ה מָטָר֙ בְּעֵ֣ת מַלְק֔וֹשׁ

And it is said:
Ask the Cause for rain at the time of late rain;
the Cause makes storm,
and will give rainshowers to them,
to each person, grass in the field. (Zechariah 10:1)

הַמַּעֲרִיב עֲרָבִים׃
Blessed are You, Cause,
who evens the evening.

Eternal love for the house of Israel Your people You have loved;

when we lie down and get up,

and rejoice in the words of Your Torah
and in Your commandments

for they our our lives and our days’ length,

And may You never ever remove Your love from us!

For They draw up the water-droplets,

And Ẓion’s children, cheer and rejoice in the Cause your God,

Blessed are You, Cause,

And you will love the Cause your God

and with all your breath
and with all your being.
And these words which I command you today
will be on your mind.
And you will drill them into your children
and speak them when you sit at home
and when you go out on the road
and when you lie down
and when you get up.
And you will tie them as a sign on your hand,
and they will be phylacteries between your eyes.
And you will write them on your house’s doorposts
and on your gates. (Deuteronomy 6:5-9)

and serving Them with all your minds and all your breaths,
and I will give your land’s rain in its time, early and late rain,
and you will gather your grain and your wine and your oil.
And I will give grass in your field for your cattle,
and you will eat and be sated.
Watch yourselves lest your minds be seduced,
and you turn and serve other gods and bow down to them.
For the Cause’s wrath will burn upon you,
and They will restrain the heavens and there will be no rain,
and the ground will not give its produce,
and you will be speedily lost from the good land
that the Cause is giving you.
And you will set these My words on your minds and on your breaths,
and you will tie them as a sign on your hands,
and they will be phylacteries between your eyes.
And you will teach your children them,
to speak them when you sit at home
and when you go out on the road
and when you lie down and when you get up.
And you will write them on your house’s doorposts
and on your gates.
Thus your days and your children’s days will be lengthened
on the ground that the Cause the God of your ancestors swore to give to them,
as long as the heaven’s days on the earth. (Deuteronomy 11:13-21)
וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם
וְעָשׂ֨וּ לָהֶ֥ם צִיצִ֛ת עַל־כַּנְפֵ֥י בִגְדֵיהֶ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָ֑ם
וְנָ֥תְנ֛וּ עַל־צִיצִ֥ת הַכָּנָ֖ף פְּתִ֥יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
וְהָיָ֣ה לָכֶם֮ לְצִיצִת֒
וּרְאִיתֶ֣ם אֹת֗וֹ וּזְכַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה
וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם
וְלֹֽא־תָת֜וּרוּ אַחֲרֵ֤י לְבַבְכֶם֙ וְאַחֲרֵ֣י עֵֽינֵיכֶ֔ם
אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם זֹנִ֖ים אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
לְמַ֣עַן תִּזְכְּר֔וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֑י
וִהְיִיתֶ֥ם קְדֹשִׁ֖ים לֵאלֹֽהֵיכֶֽם׃
אֲנִ֞י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם
אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֤אתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם
לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים
אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ (במדבר טו:לז-מא)
And the Cause spoke to Moses,
quote: “Speak to the children of Israel and say to them
to make themselves fringes on the corners of their clothes for all ages,
and put on the corner-fringes a strand of blue.
And it will be for you fringes,
and you will see it and remember all the commandments of the Cause
and do them,
and not stray after your minds and your eyes,
for you would whore after them.
Thus you will remember and do all My commandments
and be holy to your God.
I am the Cause your God
who brought you out of the land of Egypt
so as to be a God for you;
I am the Cause your God. (Numbers 15:37–41)
חזן — יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם אֱמֶת
Leader: The Cause your God is true!
וֶאֱמוּנָה כׇּל־זֹאת וְקַיָּם עָלֵֽינוּ
כִּי הוּא יְהֹוָה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ וְאֵין זוּלָתוֹ
וַאֲנַֽחְנוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַמּוֹ
הַפּוֹדֵֽנוּ מִיַּד מְלָכִים
מַלְכֵּֽנוּ הַגּוֹאֲלֵֽנוּ מִכַּף כׇּל־הֶעָרִיצִים
הָאֵל הַנִּפְרָע־לָֽנוּ מִצָּרֵֽינוּ
וְהַמְשַׁלֵּם גְּמוּל לְכׇל־אוֹיְבֵי נַפְשֵֽׁנוּ
הָעֹשֶׂ֣ה גְ֭דֹלוֹת עַד־אֵ֣ין חֵ֑קֶר
וְ֝נִפְלָא֗וֹת עַד־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃ (איוב ט:י)
הַשָּׂ֣ם נַ֭פְשֵׁנוּ בַּחַיִּ֑ים
וְלֹֽא־נָתַ֖ן לַמּ֣וֹט רַגְלֵֽנוּ׃ (תהלים סו:ט)
הַמַּדְרִיכֵֽנוּ עַל בָּמוֹת אוֹיְבֵֽינוּ
וַיָּֽרֶם קַרְנֵֽנוּ עַל כׇּל־שׂוֹנְאֵֽינוּ
הָעֽוֹשֶׂה־לָּֽנוּ נִסִּים וּנְקָמָה בְּפַרְעֹה
אוֹתוֹת ומוֹפְתִים בְּאַדְמַת בְּנֵי חָם
הַמַּכֶּה בְעֶבְרָתוֹ כׇּל־בְּכוֹרֵי מִצְרָֽיִם
וַיּוֹצֵא אֶת־עַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִתּוֹכָם לְחֵרוּת עוֹלָם
הַמַּעֲבִיר בָּנָיו בֵּין גִּזְרֵי יַם סוּף
אֶת־רוֹדְפֵיהֶם וְאֶת־שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם בִּתְהוֹמוֹת טִבַּע
וְרָאוּ בָנָיו גְּבוּרָתוֹ
שִׁבְּחוּ וְהוֹדוּ לִשְׁמוֹ
וּמַלְכוּתוֹ בְּרָצוֹן קִבְּלוּ עֲלֵיהֶם
מֹשֶׁה וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְךָ עָנוּ שִׁירָה…
…and faithful is all this, and enduring upon us,
that They are the Cause our God incomparable,
and we are Israel Their people.
Our Freer from the hand of kings,
our Sovereign who redeems us from the palm of all despots;
the Deity who pays us back from our foes
and gives just deserts to all our souls’ enemies,
who does great acts immeasureable
and wonders innumerable, (Job 9:10)
who sets our souls in life,
not letting our feet slip, (Psalms 66:9)
who leads us on the high places of our enemies
and raised our horn over all our foes,
who did miracles and vengeance on Pharaoh,
signs and portents in the land of the Ḥamites,
striking in Their wrath all Egypt’s firstborn,
and feed Their people Israel from there to eternal liberty,
passing Their children through the parts of the Reed Sea,
their pursuers and foes drowning in the depths.
And Their children saw Their greatness,
lauded and thanked Their name.
And Their sovereignty as desired they accepted upon themselves.
Moses and the children of Israel to you responded in song…
טִפּוֹת מַֽיִם נְבַקְּשֵׁם
יִׄזְּלוּ וְאַל־נֵאָשֵׁם
בְּיוֹם בַּקָּשַׁת גֶּֽשֶׁם
Trickles of water we ask for,
if they can pour and we are not held guilty
on the day of asking for rain.
יָדְךָ יִזְרֵה הַזּוֹרֶה
צַׄדְּקֵֽנוּ וְאַף אַל־תֶּחֱרֶה
בְּיוֹם בַּקָּשַׁת יוֹרֶה
Your hand sprinkles them, Sprinkler,
say we are righteous and do not rage,
on the day of asking for early-rain.
כָּעֵת שֶׁהַמֶּֽזֶג קָרִיר
חַׄדְּשֵֽׁנוּ בְּנֹֽעַם הַצַּפְרִיר
בְּיוֹם בַּקָּשַׁת הַסַּגְרִיר
Cooling is the weather;
and renew us with the zephyr’s sweetness,
on the day of asking for drizzle.
לְבַקֵּשׁ מֵאֵל אֲשֶׁר לָֽנוּ נָטַר
קְׄרַע רֹֽעַ גְּזַר־דִּין וּשְׁטַר
בְּיוֹם בַּקָּשַׁת מָטָר
Let us ask the Deity who has guarded us:
annihilate the evil written decree
on the day of asking for rainfall.
מִמַּֽיִם רַבִּים טְהוֹרִים
הַׄרְׄוֵה לָעָם הַנִּשְׁאָרִים
בְּיוֹם בַּקָּשַׁת שְׂעִירִים
May You with many pure waters
cause quenching for the remnants’ people
on the day of asking for showers.
נָא בִּתְפִלַּת הָעֲרָבִים
אֱׄלֹׄהֵי עַם הָאֲהוּבִים
תְּקַבֵּל בַּקָּשָׁתֵֽנוּ לָרְבִיבִים
Now, at the evening prayer,
the praised God of the beloved people,
accept our asking for precipitation.
הַׄכֹּֽׄחַ בְּיָדְךָ לָזוּז מַֽיִם
הִׄנֵּׄה נְבַקְשָׁה מִמְּךָ מַֽיִם
חַזְּקֵֽנוּ כְּחִזְקַֽתָּ אֶת־אֲבוֹתֵינוּ עַל־יַד הַמַָּֽיִם׃
In Your hand is the power to move water
even now we will as You for water;
strengthen us as You strengthened our ancestors by the water.
בְּגִילָה בְּרִנָּה בְּשִׂמְחָה רַבָּה וְאָמְרוּ כֻּלָּם…
מִֽי־כָמֹ֤כָה בָּֽאֵלִם֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה
מִ֥י כָּמֹ֖כָה נֶאְדָּ֣ר בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ
נוֹרָ֥א תְהִלֹּ֖ת עֹ֥שֵׂה פֶֽלֶא׃ (שמות טו:יא)
שִׁירָה חֲדָשָׁה שִׁבְּחוּ גְאוּלִים לְשִׁמְךָ
עַל־שְׂפַת הַיָּם…
In celebration, in cheer, in great joy, and they all said:
Who is like You among deities, Cause?
Who is like You, noble in holiness,
awesome in praise, wonder-working? (Exodus 15:11)
A new song the redeemed ones lauded to Your name
by the seashore…
שָׂשׂוּ בִּרְאוֹתָם כּוֹחֲךָ גּוֹזֵר מַֽיִם
עָלְזוּ בַּחֲזוֹתָם עׇצְמָתְךָ עַל־הַמַּֽיִם
פְּלָאִים עוֹשֶׂה בָּאָֽרֶץ וּבַיָּם וּבַשָּׁמַֽיִם
צוּר רֹֽנּוּ הַמּוֹשִֽׁיעַ מֵאֵשׁ וּמִמָּֽיִם׃
So they rejoiced when seeing Your power split the water.
On seeing Your might they exulted by the water.
Producing wonders on the land, sea, and sky,
Cheer for the Rock, saving from fire and from water!
זֶה צוּר יִשְׁעֵֽנוּ פָּֽצוּ פֶּה וְאָמְרוּ…
יְהֹוָ֥ה ׀ יִמְלֹ֖ךְ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃ (שמות טו:יח)
”This is our saving Rock!” Opening their mouths, they said,
The Cause will reign forever and aye! (Exodus 15:18)
קָרָא הָעָם אֵלָיו וְעָנָה בְּעֵת צָרָתוֹ
קוֹרְאִים אֲנַֽחְנוּ אֵלָיו צוֹפֵי גְּאֻלָּתוֹ
רוֹעִי הוּא לְהַרְבִּיצֵֽנִי עַל־מֵי מְנוּחָתוֹ
רָוִינוּ מִמְּטַר־אֶֽרֶץ בְּעִתּוֹ׃
Quoth the people to Them; They answered in its troubled time.
Quoth we, who await Their redemption, to Them.
Restful waters laying me down, my Shepherd are They;
Refreshed are we from the land’s rain in its time.
כַּכָּתוּב׃
יִפְתַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ לְ֠ךָ֠ אֶת־אוֹצָר֨וֹ הַטּ֜וֹב אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם
לָתֵ֤ת מְטַֽר־אַרְצְךָ֙ בְּעִתּ֔וֹ
וּלְבָרֵ֕ךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֑ךָ
וְהִלְוִ֙יתָ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים
וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֥א תִלְוֶֽה׃ (דברים כח:יב)
As it is written:
The Cause will open for you Their good treasury, the heavens,
to give your land’s rain in its time,
and to bless all your handiwork,
and you will lend to many nations
but not take loans. (Deuteronomy 28:12)
וְנֶאֱמַר׃
בִּנְא֣וֹת דֶּ֭שֶׁא יַרְבִּיצֵ֑נִי
עַל־מֵ֖י מְנֻח֣וֹת יְנַהֲלֵֽנִי׃ (תהלים כג:ב)
And it is said:
In grassy meadows laying me down,
by restful waters leading me. (Psalms 23:2)
וְנֶאֱמַר׃
וְנָתַן֩ מְטַ֨ר זַרְעֲךָ֜ אֲשֶׁר־תִּזְרַ֣ע אֶת־הָאֲדָמָ֗ה
וְלֶ֙חֶם֙ תְּבוּאַ֣ת הָאֲדָמָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה דָשֵׁ֖ן וְשָׁמֵ֑ן
יִרְעֶ֥ה מִקְנֶ֛יךָ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא כַּ֥ר נִרְחָֽב׃ (ישעיה ל:כג)
And it is said:
And They will grant rain to your seed that you sow the land,
and bread, the produce of the land, and it will be fat and rich;
your flocks will herd on that day in broad pasture. (Isaiah 30:23)
וְנֶאֱמַר׃
כִּֽי־פָדָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב
וּגְאָל֕וֹ מִיַּ֖ד חָזָ֥ק מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ (ירמיה לא:י)
בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְהֹוָה
מֶֽלֶךְ צוּר יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגֹאֲלוֹ׃
And it is said:
For the Cause saved Jacob
and redeemed him fom a hand stronger than he. (Jeremiah 31:10)
Blessed are You, Cause,
sovereign, rock, and redeemer of Israel.
הַשְׁכִּיבֵֽנוּ יְהֹוָה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ לְשָׁלוֹם
וְהַעֲמִידֵֽנוּ מַלְכֵּֽנוּ לְחַיִּים
וּפְרוֹשׂ עָלֵֽינוּ סֻכַּת שְׁלוֹמֶֽךָ
וְתַקְּנֵֽנוּ בְּעֵצָה טוֹבָה מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ
וְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנוּ לְמַֽעַן שְׁמֶֽךָ
וְהָגֵן בַּעֲדֵֽנוּ
וְהָסֵר מֵעָלֵֽינוּ אוֹיֵב דֶּֽבֶר וְחֶֽרֶב
וְרָעָב וְיָגוֹן
וְהָסֵר שָׂטָן מִלְּפָנֵֽינוּ וּמֵאַחֲרֵֽינוּ
וּבְצֵל כְּנָפֶֽיךָ תַּסְתִּירֵֽנוּ
כִּי אֵל שׁוֹמְרֵֽנוּ וּמַצִּילֵֽנוּ אָֽתָּה
כִּי אֵל מֶֽלֶךְ חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם אָֽתָּה
וּשְׁמוֹר צֵאתֵֽנוּ וּבוֹאֵֽנוּ
לְחַיִּים וּלְשָׁלוֹם
מֵעַתָּה וְעַד עוֹלָם׃
Let us lie down, Cause our God, to peace,
and stand us up, our Sovereign, to life,
and spread over us Your peace-shelter,
and affix us with good sense from You,
and save us for Your name’s sake,
and shield us
and turn away from us enemy, plague and sword
and hunger and sorrow,
and turn the adversary away from before and behind us,
and in the shade of Your wings shelter us,
for our guardian and saving Deity are You,
for a sovereign merciful and compassionate Deity are You.
And guard our comings and our goings
to life and to peace
from now and until eternity.
שׁוֹמְרֵֽנוּ וּמָגִנֵּֽנוּ הַיּוֹשֵׁב בַּשָּׁמַֽיִם
שׁוֹמֵֽעַ בַּקָּשׁוֹת אַל־תִּמְנַע מַֽיִם
תֵּן שֶׁנִּשְׁכְּבָה וְנָקֽוּמָה בִּסְפִיקַת מַֽיִם
תִּשְׁתֶּה הָאָֽרֶץ מִמְּטַר הַשָּׁמַֽיִם׃
Shielding guardian who dwells in heaven,
Showing attention to petitions, do not withhold water,
That we may lie down and rise up with enough water —
The land will drink from the rain of heaven.
כַּכָּתוּב׃
וְהָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֙מָּה֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ
אֶ֥רֶץ הָרִ֖ים וּבְקָעֹ֑ת
לִמְטַ֥ר הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם תִּשְׁתֶּה־מָּֽיִם׃ (דברים יא:יא)
As it is written:
And the land that you are crossing into to inherit
is a land of mountains and hills,
drinking water from the rain of heaven. (Deuteronomy 11:11)
וְנֶאֱמַר׃
מַשְׁקֶ֣ה הָ֭רִים מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָ֑יו
מִפְּרִ֥י מַ֝עֲשֶׂ֗יךָ תִּשְׂבַּ֥ע הָאָֽרֶץ׃ (תהלים קד:יג)
And it is said:
Watering the mountains from Their heights —
from Your work’s fruit the earth is sated. (Psalms 104:13)
וְנֶאֱמַר׃
בְּהֵעָצֵ֥ר שָׁמַ֛יִם
וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֥ה מָטָ֖ר
כִּ֣י יֶחֶטְאוּ־לָ֑ךְ
וְהִֽתְפַּלְל֞וּ אֶל־הַמָּק֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙
וְהוֹד֣וּ אֶת־שְׁמֶ֔ךָ
וּמֵחַטָּאתָ֥ם יְשׁוּב֖וּן
כִּ֥י תַעֲנֵֽם׃
וְאַתָּ֣ה ׀ תִּשְׁמַ֣ע הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם
וְסָ֨לַחְתָּ֜ לְחַטַּ֤את עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וְעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל
כִּ֥י תוֹרֵ֛ם אֶת־הַדֶּ֥רֶךְ הַטּוֹבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵֽלְכוּ־בָ֑הּ
וְנָתַתָּ֤ה מָטָר֙ עַֽל־אַרְצְךָ֔
אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה לְעַמְּךָ֖ לְנַחֲלָֽה׃ (מלכים א׳ ח:לד-לה)
And it is said:
If the heavens are shut up
and there is no rain,
for they would sin against You,
but they pray to this place
and acknowledge Your name
and repent from their sins,
You should answer them.
And You should listen from heaven
and forgive the sin of Your servants and Your people Israel,
for You will teach them the proper way in which they will walk,
and You will give rain on Your land
that You gave to Your people as an inheritance. (I Kings 8:34-35)
בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְהֹוָה
שׁוֹמֵר עַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָעַד׃
Blessed are You, Cause,
who guards Their people Israel alone.

 

Notes

Notes
1 In the additional service of Shmini ˁAtseret, the eighth day of assembly, the phrase מָשִׁיב הַרֽוּחַ וּמוֹרִיד הַגֶּֽשֶׁם is added to the gvurot (“powers”) blessing. This is referred to as gvurot gshamim (the powers of rains) as opposed to the baqashat gshamim (the requesting of rains) for which this text was written.
2 The ninth blessing of the shmone ˁesreh is the birkat ha-shanim blessing to which the baqashat gshamim is added.
3 In this case, referring to the Shemaˁ, which is three paragraphs long and recited on the deathbed. The phrase “threefold thread” is from Ecclesiastes 4:12.
4 Abraham
5 Lit. “heart.” This applies every time the word “mind” appears in this translation. In biblical physiology, the heart is said to be the seat of consciousness, while emotions are found in the kidneys.
